initialize(bytes).details: This function should be called by the DeployManager after deploying the contract

params._initData: The initialization data for the utility contract

returns._0: True if the initialization was successful

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.params: Struct containing the parameters for the new vesting schedule

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._to: Address to receive the withdrawn tokens

allocatedTokens().notice: The total amount of tokens that have been allocated for vesting

claim().notice: Claims all tokens currently available for the caller according to their vesting schedule

claimableAmount(address).notice: Returns the amount of tokens that can currently be claimed by a beneficiary

constructor.notice: Initializes the contract with deploy manager, token, and owner

getDeployManager().notice: Shows DeployManager used for deployment of current contract

getInitData(address,address,address).notice: Returns the ABI-encoded initialization data for the contract

initialize(bytes).notice: Initializes the utility contract with the provided data

startVesting((address,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Creates a new vesting schedule for a beneficiary

token().notice: The ERC20 token that is being vested

vestedAmount(address).notice: Returns the total amount of tokens vested for a beneficiary at the current time

vestings(address).notice: A mapping of beneficiary addresses to their vesting information

withdrawUnallocated(address).notice: Withdraws all unallocated tokens from the contract to the specified address
